intro: Dendrocnide corallodesme, commonly known as the coral-tipped stinging nettle, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes many species known for their stinging hairs. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges and produces small, greenish-white flowers in clusters. Its most notable characteristic is the presence of hollow, hair-like structures that release irritant compounds when touched. This plant is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas.
